_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Petroleum and Petroleum Products Merchant Wholesalers (except Bulk Stations and Terminals)

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.0   EXECUTIVE SUMMARY (40 CFR PART 68.155)

1.1    PLAN ORIGINATION



This RMP plan has been prepared by Travero for LPD in  response to the United States Environmental Protection Agency's (USEPA) accidental release prevention regulations or Risk Management Program regulations codified in part 68 of Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations (40 CFR Part 68).  



LPD stores more than 10,000 pounds of propane onsite which is received by rail and transloaded to trucks for outside delivery.  Propane storage is a covered chemical under the Risk Management Program regulations. No other chemical or substance stored or transferred at LPD is subject to Risk Management Program regulations.



1.2    PURPOSE

LPD is a transloading facility receiving material by barge, train and truck and shipping material out by barge and truck.  Examples of materials processed at LPD include grains, road salt, fertilizer and propane.  The propane is stored in two 60,000-gallon tanks in a liquid form. At full capacity, the tanks can store up to 444,000 pounds of propane. Since LPD will be storing more than 10,000 pounds of propane, it is subject to USEPA Risk Management Program regulations codified in 40 CFR Part 68.

 

Exhibit B presents the Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) for propane.



1.3    RMP CERTIFICATION

Management certification of this RMP is provided at the beginning of this document. 



The date of original RMP electronic submittal to EPA (i.e., RMP*eSubmit format)  Record and any EPA approval of this RMP shall be documented in Exhibit C of this RMP.



1.4    LOCATION OF RMP

One complete hard copy of this RMP is maintained in the administration building at LPD. In addition, this RMP is also available electronically.  The electronic copy of the RMP will be the official copy of the RMP. 



1.5    PLAN REVIEW

In accordance with 40 CFR Part 68 regulations, the Risk Management Program regulations requires a comprehensive review and re-submission every five (5) years. This Plan will be

first submitted to EPA in November 2020 and the next five (5) year review must be completed by November 2025.



Revisions and amendments to this RMP shall be documented in the RMP Review and Amendment Log in Exhibit D of this RMP.
